txt.en: 'TBD'
'TBD'
'TBD'
'I always... return....'
'You shall serve as so many have before.'
'Sing for me!'
'Agath-kali, Mistress of Lamentation! Hear my words!'
'I am Lhaereth the Stained, Lady of Blight, Ruler of Mordor.'
'I seek for the Dark Tree, Morloth.'
'Hail, Lhaereth.'
'It is a great offence to the Witch-king to come unbidden to the Houses of Lamentation...'
'See you now what awaits you?'
'...and to let your children defile its halls.'
'Is it true that Morloth serves as a vessel for lost spirits?'
'The existence of Morloth was known to but a few of the Dark Lord's servants.'
'And you were not one of them.'
''How did such knowledge come to you?'
'Through a bargain with the archivist, Dolguzigir.'
'You will be unmade!'
'Nothing for nothing, as he insisted.'
'In exchange for my Plague, I learned of the Houses of Lamentation.'
'I learned of Morloth... and I learned of you, Agath-kali.'
'A trifle for far too much, I think.'
'Tell me, Lhaereth. What is it you believe you are owed?'
'An heir. A true heir.'
'It was I who tended Sauron in His time of weakness.'
'In return, I asked only one thing of Him.'
'An heir born of our union.'
'I am here to see it fulfilled at long last!'
'I see.'
'Come, Lhaereth.'
'Now, what is this?'
'What a miserable legacy the Blood-witch has made for herself....'
'Has the fool witch led yet more unwanted guests through the Houses of Lamentation?'
'Weak, malformed children. Thin, unclean blood. None among them deserve the gift of Agath-kali... of the Witch-king!'
'It is no matter. Soon they shall bleed for you, Morloth....'
'Long ago, I was no different than you.'
'I am no mere spirit! Whatever I wish to possess shall be mine!'
'I must descend to Ghurn Grishúrz and perform the ritual at once!'
'When the Witch-king first came to Minas Ithil, I did not yield in its defence...
'...and so I fell.'
'For such audacity, the Witch-king shaped me into the first of the Unhoused.'
'Your screams sound no different!'
'Free of flesh, free of fear, free of oaths of fealty undeserved.'
'And soon, you shall see as I do!'
'Was this what you hoped to find?'
'And you... you come unbidden to Bâr Nírnaeth seeking to defile the greatest works of the Witch-king.'
'It shall not be so.'
'Your blood will nourish the roots of Morloth!'
With the sounding of heavy creaks, Morloth springs to life and attacks!
'What have they done?!'
'This is not the end of things between us, Agath-kali!'
'Wretched one!'
'Drink, Morloth! Drink and be renewed!'
'Your mind shall break!'
'Flesh is so... weak!'
'Wither... and die!'
'Noooo....'
Bâr Nírnaeth, the Houses of Lamentation
'It seems you have much still to learn.'
Morloth stills, but Agath-kali has gone to Ghurn Grishúrz below to finish her vile rites....
'Where is what I seek?'
'Dare you to deceive me, gaunt-woman?'
'My children shall descend upon the vale like locusts!'
'I shall crush you until nothing remains but your blood!'
'All of it... LIES!'
'What treachery is this?'
'Teach them as I have taught you, my servants!'
'Let it wither! Let it die! Let it take whatever remains of Sauron and cast it to the wind!'
'I am here only to possess what is owed to me.'
'It was a promise made to me by the Dark Lord.'
'If you will not give it freely, I SHALL TAKE IT!'
'IT IS MINE!'
'I was the first to bleed before Morloth.'
'Behold!'
'Morloth the Black... the Dire... the Profane.'
'You see, Lhaereth...'
'I have offered it the blood of Kings... of nobles... of peasants.'
'Though many spirits dwell within Morloth and might still be drawn from it, Sauron is not among them.'
'I have heard every desperate promise, every lamentation, every plea for death.'
'Dear child of the Elder Days, Sauron the Great has fallen where none may follow.'
'Yours, too, shall go unanswered.'
'No magic remains in this world that could draw him back from the Void.'
'He is beyond Dhak Thrakrut... beyond the Rite of Returning.'
'I am afraid you have come for naught, Lhaereth.'
'I speak no untruths.'
You must have completed 'Discovery: Bâr Nírnaeth, the Houses of Lamentation' to play this instance.
'What little fruit Morloth has yielded might indeed serve as a vessel of rebirth...'
'...but not for Him.'
'Is that so?'
'Surrender one of the fruits of Morloth, and I shall leave in peace.'
'You are bold to believe that I should answer to one as lowly as you.'
'And I am... the last....'
'I am not bound by such a promise, Lhaereth, and there shall be no peace between us.'
'Begone at once or you and your children shall feed the roots of Morloth!'
'The blood of the Unhoused is mine to command!'
'What pitiful sorcery is this?!'
'With all the gifts the Mistress has given you, none of you can put an end to these intrusions?'
'So be it.'
'I shall deliver them to Agath-kali myself!'
'Mistress Agath-kali... my blood is yours....'
'All is revealed to me.'
'Did you fools think me so easily defeated?'
